org.livingdoc.engine.fixtures

Class FixtureMethodInvoker

  • org.livingdoc.engine.fixtures.FixtureMethodInvoker

  • public class FixtureMethodInvoker

    • Constructor Detail

      • FixtureMethodInvoker

        public FixtureMethodInvoker(@Nullable
                            java.lang.Object document)

    • Method Detail

      • invokeStatic

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Object invokeStatic(@NotNull
                                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                               @NotNull
                                               java.lang.String[] arguments)

        Invoke the given static method with the given String arguments.

        Before invoking the method, the String arguments will be converted into objects of the appropriate types. This is done by looking up a matching interface TypeConverter as follows:

        1. parameter

        2. method

        3. class

        4. document

        5. default

        This method is capable of invoking any static method. If the invoked method is not public, it will be made so.

        Parameters:
        method - the Method to invoke
        arguments - the arguments for the invoked method as strings
        Returns:
        the result of the invocation or null in case the invoked method has not return type (void / Unit)
        Throws:
        StaticFixtureMethodInvocationException - in case anything went wrong with the invocation
        See Also:
        String, String, interface TypeConverter

      • invoke

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Object invoke(@NotNull
                                         java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                         @NotNull
                                         java.lang.Object fixture,
                                         @NotNull
                                         java.lang.String[] arguments)

        Invoke the given method on the given fixture instance with the given String arguments.

        Before invoking the method, the String arguments will be converted into objects of the appropriate types. This is done by looking up a matching interface TypeConverter as follows:

        1. parameter

        2. method

        3. class

        4. document

        5. default

        This method is capable of invoking any method on the given fixture instance. If the invoked method is not public, it will be made so.

        Parameters:
        method - the Method to invoke
        fixture - the fixture instance to invoke the method on
        arguments - the arguments for the invoked method as strings
        Returns:
        the result of the invocation or null in case the invoked method has not return type (void / Unit)
        Throws:
        FixtureMethodInvocationException - in case anything went wrong with the invocation
        ExpectedException - in case the thrown exception was expected
        See Also:
        String, String, interface TypeConverter
